newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: SOCCER-ARGENTINE NAME SQUAD FOR HIGH-ALTITUDE TRAINING.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ARGENTINE NAME SQUAD FOR HIGH-ALTITUDE TRAINING.

text.p: Argentina coach Daniel Passarella on Friday included 10 uncapped players in a squad to take part in a high-altitude training camp in the run-up to next month's World Cup qualifier away to Bolivia.
Although the squad is not final, Passarella made it clear that he intended to put the emphasis on youth for the game in La Paz at 3,600 metres above sea level.
The squad consisted entirely of home-based players for the training camp which will be held at La Quiaca, high in the Argentine Andes.

Passarella said he would eventually include a maximum of five foreign-based players who, under rules laid down by international soccer's governing body FIFA, have to be released by their clubs 10 days before games in the Bolivian capital.

This compares with the three weeks generally recognised as the time necessary to adapt fully to the altitude of La Paz, which can leave new arrivals breathless with a splitting headache and a thumping pain in the chest.
The coach, who is under slightly less pressure after last month's 1-0 win away to Colombia, said that any player who did not adapt well to high altitude would be sent back and replaced.
Goalkeepers - Ignacio Gonzalez (Racing Club), Carlos Roa (Lanus).
Defenders - Hernan Diaz (River Plate), Nelson Vivas (Boca Juniors), Carlos Galvan (Racing Club) Pablo Rotchen (Independiente), Juan Sorin (River Plate), Mauricio Pineda (Boca Juniors).

Midfielders - Gustavo Zapata (San Lorenzo), Julio Saldana (Newell's Old Boys), Marcelo Herrera (Velez Sarsfield), Diego Cagna (Boca Juniors), Andres Yllana (Gimnasia La Plata), Christian Bassedas (Velez Sarsfield), Hugo Morales (Lanus), Nestor Gorosito (San Lorenzo), Angel Morales (Independiente).
Delanteros - Marcelo Delgado (Racing Club), Martn Posse (Velez Sarsfield), Claudio Biaggio (San Lorenzo), Jos Calderon (Independiente), Julio Cruz (River Plate).
